title: Fibre in diet can reduce risk of gut infections: 6 ways to add more fibre in meals - The Times of India
summary:
Fibre in Diet Can Reduce Risk of Gut Infections: 6 Ways to Add More Fibre in Meals

Date: December 8, 2023 | Source: IANS

The article discusses the importance of dietary fibre in reducing the risk of gut infections and suggests six practical ways to incorporate more fibre into meals.

  • Start the Day Right: Choose high-fibre breakfast options like whole-grain cereals or muesli topped with fruits and nuts.
  • Whole Grains Over Refined: Swap refined grains for whole grains like brown rice, quinoa, and whole-wheat bread.
  • Load Up on Fruits and Vegetables: Incorporate a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables into your diet for added fibre and nutrients.
  • Add Lentils and Beans: Use lentils, chickpeas, and beans in soups, salads, and stews for a fibre boost.
  • Choose Nuts and Seeds: Snack on nuts and seeds instead of less healthy options to increase your fibre intake.
  • Opt for Fibre-Enriched Foods: Look for packaged snacks and drinks labelled as high in fibre, but check ingredient lists for sugar and unhealthy fats.
“Dietary fiber reduces the chance of heart disease, type 2 diabetes, and some types of cancer.”

By incorporating these strategies, individuals can significantly boost their fibre intake, supporting overall gut health and reducing the risk of infections.
newTitle: Fibre in Diet Can Reduce Gut Infection Risk: 6 Simple Ways to Increase Intake

title: First full Moon of 2025: Will Wolf Moon be visible from India; know details - Business Standard
summary:
First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

Date: Today

Source: Unspecified

The first full moon of 2025, known as the Wolf Moon, features a rare occurrence where it will pass in front of Mars, leading to a lunar occultation.

Key Points:

  • The lunar occultation occurs as the moon obscures Mars, which is approximately 40,000 times brighter.
  • The full moon peaks at 3:57 AM IST.
  • The Wolf Moon is named for the active howling of wolves in January.
  • This celestial event can be viewed using telescopes or binoculars, as Mars will not be visible from India.
No, the first full moon of January 2025 wouldn't be visible from India.

Only locations in the contiguous United States and parts of Canada will witness this spectacular event.
newTitle: First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

summary:
Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Inside the management of the world’s largest pilgrimage

Publication Date: 2025-01-12 | Source: CNBC TV18

The Maha Kumbh Mela, held in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, is recognized as the world’s largest gathering of humanity, with an expected 400 million visitors over six weeks.

  • A temporary city built for 150,000 pilgrims with sanitation facilities.
  • Massive security arrangements including over 50,000 personnel deployed.
  • Advanced technology used for surveillance and safety measures.
  • Significant investment in fire safety with ₹1.3 billion allocated.
  • Dedicated lost-and-found centers to assist separated families.
“Security is a cornerstone of the festival's management, with authorities implementing an extensive and multi-layered safety plan.”

The Maha Kumbh Mela serves as a testament to India's logistical capabilities in managing large-scale events, ensuring the safety and comfort of millions of participants.
newTitle: Managing the Maha Kumbh Mela 2025: Logistics and Security of the World's Largest Pilgrimage

Sierra Leone declares emergency after confirming second Mpox case in four days - CNBCTV18
summary:
Sierra Leone Declares Emergency After Second Mpox Case in Four Days

Date: January 13, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Sierra Leone has declared a state of emergency after confirming its second case of Mpox within four days, as health authorities express concern over the rapid spread of the disease.

  • The first case involved recent travel to the northern Port Loko District.
  • Both patients are currently receiving treatment in Freetown.
  • Mpox was first identified in 1958, historically affecting mostly people in central and West Africa.
  • In 2022, Mpox was confirmed to spread through sexual intercourse, leading to outbreaks in over 70 countries.
  • Sierra Leone was previously the epicentre of the 2014 Ebola outbreak, resulting in significant loss of life and healthcare workforce.
"The Congo has borne the brunt of the epidemic, with a vast majority of the roughly 43,000 suspected cases and 1,000 deaths in Africa this year."

This situation poses a significant public health challenge, especially in the context of Sierra Leone's past experiences with epidemics.
newTitle: Sierra Leone Declares Emergency After Second Mpox Case in Four Days

title: Sores in genital areas? This could be a sign of Herpes virus - The Times of India
summary:
Sores in genital areas? This could be a sign of Herpes virus

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

This article discusses the indications and implications of herpes simplex virus (HSV), highlighting symptoms, causes, and prevention strategies.

  • Herpes simplex virus causes sores in oral and genital areas.
  • Genital herpes is an STI; 1 in 5 women aged 14-49 are affected.
  • 67% of the global population under age 50 is at risk of HSV.
  • Risk factors include unprotected sex and multiple partners.
  • Early detection through various testing methods improves treatment outcomes.
  • Prevention includes abstinence, condom use, and maintaining hygiene during outbreaks.
“The common risk factors include sexual contact with someone infected with hsv-1 or hsv-2...” - Dr. Archana Dhawan Bajaj

Understanding and preventing herpes involves knowledge about its symptoms, responsible sexual practices, and timely medical intervention.
newTitle: Understanding Herpes: Symptoms, Causes, and Prevention Tips

title: ‘Would rather like people to be…’: ITC chairman Sanjiv Puri on 90-hour work week debate - Hindustan Times
summary:
ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri Responds to 90-Hour Work Week Debate

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sanjiv Puri, chairman and MD of ITC Limited, expressed that the company prefers not to quantify work hours, focusing instead on employee engagement.

  • During a recent event, Sanjiv Puri highlighted that ITC emphasizes being part of the company's journey rather than logging hours.
  • Puri declined to specify work hour numbers, stressing a flexible work environment including remote work options.
  • This discussion comes in light of comments from L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for a 90-hour work week, which drew significant criticism.
“We would rather like people to be part of the company's journey and feel passionately involved.” - Sanjiv Puri

The remarks from both Sanjiv Puri and SN Subrahmanyan have sparked discussions on work-life balance in corporate settings, highlighting contrasting management philosophies.
newTitle: ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri Responds to 90-Hour Work Week Debate

title: Meta To Get Parliamentary Panel Summons Over Zuckerberg's India Poll Remark - NDTV
summary:
"Would Have To Apologise...": House Panel To Summon Mark Zuckerberg's Meta

Date: January 10, 2024

Source: New Delhi

Social media giant Meta is set to be summoned by a Parliamentary Standing Committee due to remarks made by its CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, regarding the 2024 Indian general election.

  • Meta is being accused of spreading misinformation about the electoral results in India.
  • Zuckerberg's comments suggested a global trend where incumbent governments lost elections due to the COVID pandemic, incorrectly citing India as an example.
  • Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw countered Zuckerberg's claims, stating that the NDA led by PM Modi retained trust among voters in the recent elections.
  • The BJP faced some setbacks in elections but maintained a majority with support from allies.
"Misinformation on a democratic country maligns its image. The organization would have to apologize to the Parliament and the people here for this mistake." - Nishikant Dubey

The ruling BJP's response highlights the importance of factual accuracy in public statements, especially from influential leaders like Zuckerberg.
newTitle: "Would Have To Apologise...": House Panel To Summon Mark Zuckerberg's Meta

title: ‘Jammu and Kashmir incomplete without PoK’: Defence minister Rajnath Singh - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Jammu and Kashmir incomplete without PoK’: Defence minister Rajnath Singh

Date: Jan 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Defence minister Rajnath Singh emphasized that Jammu and Kashmir is 'incomplete' without Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) and cautioned Pakistan against the existence of terrorist training camps in the region.

  • Singh stated that PoK is essentially a foreign territory for Pakistan.
  • He warned that the land is being exploited for fostering terrorism.
  • At the 9th Armed Forces Veterans' Day event, he highlighted historical conflicts, referencing a potential end to cross-border terrorism in 1965.
  • Singh acknowledged the sacrifices made by the Muslim community in fighting against terrorism.
  • He pointed out the government's priority to bridge the gap between Kashmir and the rest of India.
"Our Muslim brothers have sacrificed their lives fighting against terrorism. More than 80 per cent of terrorists entering India are from Pakistan."

The Defence Minister's remarks come in the context of ongoing tensions and the importance of unity between regions in India, as articulated during the Armed Forces Veterans' Day celebrations.
newTitle: Rajnath Singh: Jammu and Kashmir Incomplete Without PoK

title: At least six Army personnel injured in landmine explosion in J&K’s Rajouri - The Hindu
summary:
Landmine Explosion Injures Six Army Personnel in Jammu and Kashmir

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: PTI

At least six Army personnel were injured in a landmine explosion while on patrol duty in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir.

  • The incident occurred near Khamba Fort in the Nowshera sector around 10:45 AM.
  • Initial reports indicate that one soldier accidentally triggered the explosion by stepping on the landmine.
  • The injured personnel were quickly transported to the hospital, and their condition is stable.
  • Landmines are commonly placed in forward areas as part of an anti-infiltration obstacle system, but weather can cause these to become displaced.
“The troops were on patrol duty when one of the soldiers accidentally stepped over the landmine.”

This incident highlights the dangers faced by military personnel in conflict zones, particularly with the prevalence of landmines in sensitive areas.
newTitle: Landmine Explosion Injures Six Army Personnel in Jammu and Kashmir

title: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra signals he’s open to more flexible rupee - The Economic Times
summary:
RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra signals he’s open to more flexible rupee

Publication date: January 2023

Source: Economic Times

The new central bank governor of India shows willingness to let the rupee move freely while managing excessive volatility in the foreign-exchange market.

  • Governor Sanjay Malhotra, in office since December, has shown interest in the RBI’s currency intervention.
  • He indicated a departure from previous policies that aimed to tightly control the rupee's value.
  • Since the departure of former Governor Shaktikanta Das, the rupee has seen increased volatility.
  • The RBI’s strategy may involve allowing a wider range in the currency's closing value.
  • Exporters have expressed concerns about the impact of a stable rupee on competitiveness.
  • Recent trends show significant investor pullouts amid currency fluctuations, indicating a reevaluation of currency policies.
“The depreciation in the rupee corrects some of the overvaluation.”

The RBI is balancing currency flexibility with the implications of India’s energy import costs, keeping a close watch on market conditions.
newTitle: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra signals he’s open to more flexible rupee

title: 'As if Trump came to sell kheer': US President-elect's look-alike pitches pudding on streets of Pakistan - Deccan Herald
summary:
As if Trump came to sell kheer: US President-elect's look-alike pitches pudding on streets of Pakistan

Publication Date: November 21, 2024 | Source: Deccan Herald

A food vendor in Pakistan, Saleem Bagga, who resembles US President-elect Donald Trump, is drawing global attention as he sells kheer (a type of pudding) on the streets.

  • Bagga's resemblance to Trump has sparked humor and curiosity among both locals and tourists.
  • He engages customers by singing Punjabi songs near his cart.
  • Local residents express their amusement, with one saying, "We feel as if Trump has come here to sell kheer."
  • His kheer is popular, and people share selfies with him, joking they met Trump.
"His kheer is really delicious ...we take selfies with him and we tell our friends that we have taken these pictures with Trump," said a local.

In conclusion, Bagga's unique situation not only entertains but also promotes local cuisine, drawing smiles and laughter from the community.
newTitle: US President-elect's Look-Alike Sells Pudding on Streets of Pakistan

Is Obesity in Children With Cancer Tied to Worse Survival? - Medscape
summary:
Is Obesity in Children With Cancer Tied to Worse Survival?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Cancer

Overall, obesity at the time of cancer diagnosis is independently associated with worse survival outcomes in pediatric patients, particularly in those with acute lymphoblastic leukemia and CNS tumors.

  • The study analyzed data from 11,291 pediatric cancer patients.
  • Obesity was observed in 10.5% of the cohort at diagnosis.
  • An adjusted hazard ratio indicated a 1.16 increase in risk for event-free survival and 1.29 for overall survival for obese patients.
  • Children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia saw significantly lower 5-year event-free survival rates (84.5% vs 89.8%) and overall survival rates (89.8% vs 94.4%).
  • In CNS tumor patients, obesity was associated with lower 5-year event-free and overall survival rates.
  • No significant associations were found for patients with lymphomas or non-CNS solid tumors.
“Although obesity at cancer diagnosis was independently associated with inferior survival across the entire cohort, this finding was likely driven by the trends detected in children with ALL [acute lymphoblastic leukemia] and CNS tumors,”

Overall, this study highlights the complex relationship between obesity and cancer outcomes in children, emphasizing the need for further research.
newTitle: Is Obesity in Children With Cancer Tied to Worse Survival?

title: Vivo T3 Ultra, T3 Pro prices officially reduced in India. How much do they cost now? | Mint - Mint
summary:
Vivo T3 Ultra and T3 Pro Prices Slashed in India

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Vivo has announced a price reduction for its popular mid-range smartphones, the Vivo T3 Ultra and T3 Pro, amidst competition from Poco and Realme.

  • The Vivo T3 Pro now costs ₹22,999 for the 8GB/128GB variant and ₹24,999 for the 8GB/256GB variant, after a ₹2,000 reduction.
  • The Vivo T3 Ultra is now priced starting at ₹29,999, with the top variant costing ₹33,999.
  • Both phones are equipped with features such as 120Hz refresh rate displays and 5G connectivity.
  • The T3 Ultra boasts a MediaTek Dimensity 9200+ chipset, while the T3 Pro is powered by a Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 processor.
"Vivo claims the T3 Ultra has achieved an impressive Antutu benchmark score exceeding 1.6 million."

In conclusion, the price cuts make both Vivo models more competitive in the Indian market.
newTitle: Vivo T3 Ultra and T3 Pro Prices Slashed in India
